required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 1/2 Multicenter Dose Escalation and Expansion Study Of NKTR-214 In Subjects With Locally Advanced Or Metastatic Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Multicenter, Dose Escalation And Expansion Study Of NKTR-214 In Subjects With Locally Advanced Or Metastatic Solid Tumor Malignancies

brief_summary.textblock: This is a first in human, open-label, sequential dose escalation and expansion Phase 1 study of NKTR-214 in adult patients with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumors.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety of NKTR-214 as evaluated by incidence of drug-related adverse events (AEs), serious adverse events (SAEs), adverse events leading to discontinuation, deaths and clinical laboratory test abnormalities

Tolerability of NKTR-214 as evaluated by incidence of dose limiting toxicities (DLTs), drug-related adverse events (AEs), serious adverse events (SAEs), adverse events leading to discontinuation, deaths and clinical laboratory test abnormalities

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective response rate (ORR) of NKTR-214 based on investigator review of radiographic images
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an expected average of 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Best overall response (BOR) in the population of interest
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an expected average of 1 year
Through study completion, an expected average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: It is defined as time between the date of first radiographic documented objective response and the date of the radiographic documented disease progression.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an expected average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as the time from date of enrollment to the date of the first objectively documented tumor progression or death due to any cause

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an expected average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical benefit rate will be assessed as the number of subjects with confirmed complete response (CR), partial response (PR), or stable disease (SD) (where the duration of SD should be ≥ 3 months) divided by the total number of subjects in the Response Evaluable Population

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an expected average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: The median time to response will be summarized descriptively for subjects who have a CR or PR.
Overall survival is defined as the time from date of enrollment to the date of death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum observed plasma concentration (Cmax) of NKTR-214
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycle 1 and 2: pre-dose and end of administration, 0.5 hr., 3 hr., 6 hr., Post dosing on Days 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 11, and 15 for Cycle 1 and 2

secondary_outcome.measure: Time of maximum observed plasma concentration (Tmax) of NKTR-214
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycle 1 and 2: pre-dose and end of administration, 0.5 hr., 3 hr., 6 hr., Post dosing on Days 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 11, and 15 for Cycle 1 and 2

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration time curve in the dosing interval AUC(TAU) of NKTR-214
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycle 1 and 2: pre-dose and end of administration, 0.5 hr., 3 hr., 6 hr., Post dosing on Days 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 11, and 15 for Cycle 1 and 2
Day 1 of Cycle 1 and 2: pre-dose and end of administration, 0.5 hr., 3 hr., 6 hr., Post dosing on Days 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 11, and 15 for Cycle 1 and 2

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional and phenotypic characterization of peripheral immune cells by flow cytometry
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 and Day 8 of Cycle 1 and 2

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in soluble cytokines and chemokines by multiplex immunoassay
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 and Day 8 of Cycle 1 and 2

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional and phenotypic characterization of tumor immune infiltrates (TIL) by flow cytometry.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and week 3 after first dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional and phenotypic characterization of tumor immune infiltrate (TIL) by next generation sequencing of T cell receptors
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and week 3 after first dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional and phenotypic characterization of tumor immune infiltrate (TIL) by immunohistochemistry (IHC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and week 3 after first dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity analysis to assess antibodies to NKTR-214 in human serum
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Screening and pre-dose of Day 1 of Cycle 2 and odd-numbered cycles there after (Cycle 3, 5, 7…)

clinical_study.condition: Unspecified Adult Solid Tumor, Protocol Specific

arm_group.description: This is a first in human, open-label, sequential dose escalation and expansion Phase 1 study of NKTR--214 in adult patients with locally advanced and metastatic solid tumors. The Phase 1 stage of the study is designed as an open-label dose escalation trial of NKTR--214 in participants with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumors. The goal of the dose escalation stage of the study is to find the recommended phase 2 dose, to evaluate the efficacy of NKTR--214 by assessing the objective response rate and to evaluate the safety of NKTR-214. Immunological biomarkers in plasma and tumor samples will also be measured.

intervention.description: Participants in the dose escalation cohorts will be treated every 21 days (q21d) or every 14 days (q14d) until tumor progression.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically confirmed diagnosis of a locally advanced or metastatic solid tumor.
- Received 1 or 2 prior lines of therapy.
- Life expectancy >12 weeks.
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status 0 to 1.
- Measurable disease per RECIST v1.1.
- Demonstrated adequate organ function within 14 days of treatment initiation.
- Subjects must be recovered from the effects of any prior chemotherapy, immunotherapy, other prior system anticancer therapy, radiotherapy or surgery.
- Women of childbearing potential must agree to use highly effective methods of birth control.
- All participants must agree to use double barrier contraception during study participation and for at least 2 months after the last dose of study drug.
- Additional criteria may apply.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of an investigational agent or an investigational device within 28 days before administration of first dose of NKTR-214.
- Females who are pregnant or breastfeeding.
- Participants who have an active autoimmune disease requiring systemic treatment within the past 3 months or have a documented history of clinically severe autoimmune disease that requires systemic steroids or immunosuppressive agents.
- Active central nervous system (CNS) metastases.
- Prior surgery or radiotherapy within 14 days of therapy.
- Participants who have had < 28 days since the last chemotherapy, immunotherapy, biological therapy, or < 14 days from approved tyrosine kinase inhibitor (TKI) therapy (sunitinib, sorafenib, vemurafenib, dabrafenib, cobretinib), or systemic or inhaled steroid therapy at doses greater than 10mg of prednisone or equivalent before administration of the first dose of study medication.
- Participants' inability to adhere to or tolerate protocol or study procedures.
- Additional criteria may apply.
